If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!

**Version Number:** 9.3.17.0
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-5133/folder/13176744/41237148/1186707000
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+2250@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 (Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace.
Prerequisite 2: Distance expense previously created so waypoints are already saved.
1. Open the Expensify app.
2. Open any workspace chat.
3. Turn off internet connection.
4. Create a distance expense with "Map" option.
5. Open the report of the just created expense.
6. Note that next steps message displays "Waiting for you to add expenses" instead of "Waiting for you to submit expenses"

## Expected Result:
After creating a distance expense while in offline mode, next step message displayed should be "Waiting for you to submit expenses"

## Actual Result:
After creating a distance expense while in offline mode, next step message displayed is "Waiting for you to add expenses", despite report already having an expense in it.

## Workaround:
Unknown

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:**
**Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Unable to reproduce)
**Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @JamieMcElroy
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1770849840990319)

## Action Performed:

1. Log in as Workspace Admin
2. Navigate to Workspace → Rules → Expenses
3. Set Cash expense default to Always reimbursable
4. Save the setting
5. Create a new Cash expense
6. Observe the reimbursable toggle
7. Click the toggle

## Expected Result:
When “Always reimbursable” is selected:
New cash expenses should default to reimbursable.
The reimbursable field should either clearly reflect the locked reimbursable status (if intended to be non-editable) or behave consistently with the setting.
## Actual Result:
Newly created expenses appear greyed out under the reimbursable field.
Clicking the field changes the status unexpectedly.
## Workaround:
Unknown

title: Make report title editing more obvious

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Users are struggling to figure out how to edit the report title, which makes sense because: 1) There is no UI pattern suggesting that clicking on the title edits it; 2) Finding it otherwise requires knowing that the the report title lives in the `Details` page. We'll add a pencil icon to make it more obvious that editing is possible, like so. Product/design details: - Standard pencil icon (sized at `16x16px`; `4px` away from the title) - Clicking the title and/or pencil icon goes to the report Details > Title page - The page opens up in the right-hand pane - The pencil only appears if the user looking at the report can edit the report name (this feature is sometimes restricted to admins). - This feature is desktop only (e.g. large screens). Any other questions, let us know
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @parasharrajat

**Version Number:** 9.3.18-0
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/79529
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** jsodjsojsojdniosdjnsoi@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Mac 26.2 / Chrome
**App Component:** Workspace Settings

## Action Performed:
1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com
2. Create a new Gmail account by going to the Gmail website, clicking on 'Create account', and following the sign-up process.
3. Click Skip on work email step.
4. Select Track and budget expenses.
5. Enter name, skip workspace creation and complete the onboarding
6. Go offline.
7. Create a workspace.
8. Go to workspace settings > Workflows.
9. Go online.

## Expected Result:
In Step 8, Payments should be disabled when workspace is created offline

## Actual Result:
In Step 8, Payments is enabled when workspace is created offline
In Step 9, after returning online, Payments is disabled

## Workaround:
Unknown

## Platforms:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

title: [$1000] Add custom columns to the report details view

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Coming from: [expensify.slack.com/archives/C03U7DCU4/p1768343665411189](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C03U7DCU4/p1768343665411189) We'd like to add support for custom columns in the report details page --- ### Updating the design for the report details page layout Start by removing the 'Report Layout' option from the 'More' menu in the report details RHP Move the `group by category/tag` list option to the report details page as a dropdown Add the 'Columns' button to the top of the report details page as well --- ### Adding functionality When the user clicks Customize columns, we will open the same columns RHP as we do on the search page. We will refactor `SearchColumnsPage.tsx` to be a common component (which will take in a list of current columns). When the user saves the changes in the report details column RHP, we will call SetReportDetailsColumns with the new value for the columns We will support the same columns functionality as the reports page, including dragging to re-order, selecting and un-selecting columns, and horizontal scrolling (when needed) in the report view --- ### Storing the users preferences Unlike custom columns in the reports page, we _will_ store the users report layout preferences (column-wise) on the account level. We return a NVP named `reportDetailsColumns` that is an array of strings (column Ids). To store the users preferences/update the NVP, we've added a new command: New API Command Details **Command Name:** SetReportDetailsColumns **Params:** **string authToken** **string columns** - The json stringified value of the columns to show. This is an array of column ids (strings)
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @truph01

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.16-9 **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Unable to reproduce) **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @AHowell14 **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1770837585394609) ## Action Performed: 1. Log into New Expensify on Web as a report approver who does not have the business bank account connected in their Wallet 2. From the left-hand navigation, click on Home 3. Observe the To Do section: note the “Pay X reports” task 4. Click on Reports 5. Under the To Do tab/list, observe that “Pay X reports” is also displayed ## Expected Result: If the user does not have the relevant business bank account connected in their Wallet (and therefore cannot pay workspace reports), they should not see a “Pay X reports” task. ## Actual Result: The approver sees a “Pay X reports” task on both the Home page and the Reports To Do section, despite not having the business bank account in their Wallet. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos The screenshot for the issue is in Slack [thread](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1770837585394609) [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Reproduction blocked) **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @AndrewGable **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Quality](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1770832351753919) ## Action Performed: 1. Have an active workspace with a billing balance due 2. Delete the workspace without clearing the balance 3. Attempt to close the account 4. Observe the error message indicating money is owed 5. Attempt to locate billing to clear the balance ## Expected Result: When a user attempts to delete their last workspace while an outstanding balance exists: A “Pay and downgrade” prompt should appear clearly explaining: There is an outstanding balance that must be paid before deleting the workspace. The exact amount owed. ## Actual Result: Account closure is blocked due to unpaid balance. Billing UI is not accessible because there are no active workspaces.User has no visible way to resolve the outstanding amount. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
